EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
• Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network  
  Purpose: Automates the conversion of raw ores into smelted products.  
  Consists of:  
  – Interconnected stone furnaces served by burner‑inserters and transport belts  
  – Wooden chests acting as buffer storage  
  – Belt groups that route smelted outputs onward to processing zones

• Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup  
  Purpose: Streamlines the extraction of iron ore and its delivery to processing facilities.  
  Consists of:  
  – Burner‑mining drills extracting raw iron ore  
  – Networks of burner‑inserters, transport belts, and chests that manage ore flow

• Steam Power Generation System  
  Purpose: Converts fuel and water into steam energy to power the factory.  
  Consists of:  
  – A boiler positioned at (8.0, 20.5) with connection points at (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5)  
  – Multiple steam engines (generators) deployed around the boiler at positions including (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5), and (4.5, 23.5)  
  – One extra steam engine remains unplaced; persistent spatial congestion in the boiler zone—caused by overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts—prevents its installation

• Automation Research Lab  
  Purpose: Facilitates technology research and advancement through the production of science packs.  
  Consists of:  
  – Laboratory units (noting intermittent power connectivity issues)

• Electricity, Transport, and Fluid Infrastructure  
  Purpose: Provides the backbone networks for power distribution, material logistics, and fluid transfer across production areas.  
  Consists of:  
  – Multiple electricity groups (managing power poles and network connectivity)  
  – Belt groups that interconnect various production sectors  
  – Several PipeGroups that form distinct fluid systems for routing liquids

• Offshore Pump and Fluid Network  
  Purpose: Secures a reliable water supply for fluid‐dependent processes.  
  Consists of:  
  – An offshore pump extracting water (located at approximately (0.5, 30.5))  
  – Associated PipeGroups that distribute water across the map

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue  
  – The boiler zone at Position (8.0, 20.5) remains congested due to overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts, which block clear buildable space.  
  – Interfering placements persist even near the secondary connection point at (8.5, 22.5), preventing the extra steam engine from being installed despite available inventory.  
  – To mitigate the issue, manually reassess the boiler zone layout: remove or reposition conflicting entities, adjust adjoining connection interfaces, or consider relocating the extra steam engine to a less congested area so that adequate space is freed for its proper placement.
